framework

Class LocalClassLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.ClassLoader
      • framework.LocalClassLoader

  • public class LocalClassLoader
extends ClassLoader
    The LocalClassLoader extends the standard Java ClassLoader and is used to load the specific implementation classes into the framework and for testing purposes into the GUI.

    In Java there is a hierarchy of the ClassLoaders, which has to be considered when adding a new ClassLoader.

    This class furthermore contains methods to instantiate Implementations. *

    Author:
    Daniel Kaiser

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static LocalClassLoader localClassLoader
      The instantiated localClassLoader is needed, when the class could not be loaded by the SystemClassLoader.

        Throws:

      • loadClassFile

        public static Class<?> loadClassFile(String binaryClassName)
                              throws ClassNotFoundException
        This method is used to load a class file from the file system into the framework. First, the LocalClassLoader tries to load the class using the SystemClassLoader, after that, the localClassLoader object itself. This uses the method loadClass of the super class ClassLoader which is not overwritten.
        Parameters:
        binaryClassName - name of the class to load
        Returns:
        instantiated class
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - Exception, when class is not found

      • normalizeBinaryClassName

        public static String normalizeBinaryClassName(String binaryClassName)
        This method normalizes a class name and deletes the ending.
        Parameters:
        binaryClassName - class name to normalize
        Returns:
        normalizes class name
